title: How to become a writer after MBBS - Quora
tags: Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Degrees

response.answer_text: You need to ask yourself is what you want to write. Off the top of my head here is what you can do: Books? I’ve read that its very difficult to sustain yourself in this line. You just can’t seem to sell enough books even if you’re a decent writer. Unless you have independent income this might be hard to sustain. Articles? You can always start-off as a content writer but the hours are long and pay is mediocre at best. Blog? This works if you find a niche (something you’re interested in) and can build up a dedicated audience. Initially, it can be discouraging. Medical content? There ought to be a space out there for people who can create medicine-related content whether it is books, articles, blogs, proof-reading or ghost-writing. If I were you this is the space I would look to get to.

I think you can definitely become a good writer, but why to wait for completing MBBS . Start to narrate the fire within you , your experiences , your medical exposures, sentimental experiences that you have came across while studying on a paper right now and you will have books compiled when you complete your MBBS. You can start following Aakriti Jha a student from MBBS on Quora.She is a cool writer and may be provide you a better guidance.
